@drpngx wouldn't that either be redundant with tf.slice or be better named tf.crop since it is not random?

I think for specific use cases like segmentation getting the behavior defined by random_crop and just having it feed you exactly what it cropped might be more useful. Or what if random_crop could take in additional tensors that would all be cropped the same way?

body:
@drpngx wouldn't that either be redundant with `tf.slice` or be better named `tf.crop` since it is not random?

I think for specific use cases like segmentation getting the behavior defined by `random_crop` and just having it feed you exactly what it cropped might be more useful. Or what if `random_crop` could take in additional tensors that would all be cropped the same way?
